author: Pon Vasanth Arunachalam
text:
Collector meets representatives of recognised political parties

A two-week exercise for purification of electoral rolls in all the 10 Assembly constituencies in Madurai district commenced on Monday, Collector K. Veera Raghava Rao said.

Speaking to The Hindu , Mr. Rao said that Booth Level Officers (BLOs) would take up door-to-door visits to verify the electoral rolls and any duplicate entries or names of deceased or migrated persons found would be deleted.

He said that the BLOs would also work closely with agents of recognised political parties in identifying entries that were to be removed.

“Public can also verify the electoral rolls to check if their names have been included and they can apply for inclusion or changes as needed,” he said.

Earlier, on Monday, the Collector presided over a meeting with representatives of recognised political parties in which he assured that all efforts would be made to remove duplicate entries in the voters’ list.

Representatives from AIADMK, DMK, DMDK, CPI (M) and BSP, among other parties, attended the meeting.

The DMK representatives claimed that they had identified at least 457 duplicate entries in Madurai Central constituency and at least 397 duplicate entries in Madurai West constituency.

Official sources said that it was estimated that around 15,000 entries, which could be duplicate or that of deceased persons, would be in the present electoral rolls. “Our target during the purification exercise will be to at least identify and remove these 15,000 entries,” an official said.

Apart from this exercise, Mr. Rao said that effort was also being made to get more first time voters enrolled in the list.
title: Electoral roll purification exercise commences
